reviewText: This review is really of the actual PPV, which I still have in its original form on VHS. I don't know what the Turner Home Entertainment version has on it. This event was original dedicated to the legends of pro wrestling and had many future stars on here. This is what I remember from memory:2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Bagwell Vs. "Beautiful" Bobby Eaton & Chris Benoit - This was 1993 and while Bobby Eaton was nearing the end of his career, the other three in this match were at or not too far from the beginning of theirs. We pretty much know what happened to all of them (particularly Benoit) so no need to rehash.To the match itself, it was a good opener with rivals Scorpio and Benoit starting it off. Nasty ending when 2 Cold attempted a twisting summersault into a legdrop on Benoit but landed a**-first on Benoit's face! Ouch! Talk about a botched spot!? Anyway, it ended after that part.Dick Murdoch, Don Muraco & "Superfly" Jimmy Snuka Vs. Jim Brunzell, Wahoo McDaniel and Blackjack Mulligan - This six man was the first of three matches with legends of the game! Two of which (McDaniel and Murdoch) are no longer with us at the time I write this. Not a good six man but considering their ages at this point, I am amazed they could do what they did do! Ends in a double DQ when it got all out of control!"Thunderbolt" Patterson & Brad Armstrong Vs. Baron Von Rashke & Ivan Koloff - Probably the best of the legends matches as Patterson was comical in some of his moves! Brad, by the way, was a fill in for his father "Bullet" Bob Armstrong who couldn't make it due to an injury. Ends when Patterson got in his pattened double chop to the throat of Rashke for the pin.Nick Bockwinkle Vs. Dory Funk, Jr. - In sort of an AWA Vs. NWA match, Bockwinkle took on the more saner of the Funk Brothers with respective cornermen. Verne Gange for Bockwinkle and the late Gene Kinski for Funk. The match, for the most part, was clean and was mostly wrestling. Ended in a draw.Sting Vs. The Prisoner (Nailz for WWE fans) - Not a good match at all. Pretty much a throw away. By the way, Sting won."Mr. Wonderful" Paul Orndorff & "Ravishing" Rick Rude Vs. Dustin Rhodes & Kensuki Sasaki - Pretty good tag team encounter. A bit sloppy at times but it especially picked up when Rhodes and the late Rick Rude got it on! Ends when Rude gets in his pattened "Rude Awakening" neckbreaker on Sasaki for the pin.The Hollywood Blondes ("Stunning" Steve Austin & the late Brian Pillman) Vs. Ricky Steamboat & "Shane Douglas" (cage match for the WCW/NWA World Tag Team Titles) - I put Shane in quotation marks because it wasn't actually Douglas in that match. It was actually Tom Zenk (I think) playing Douglas due to the fact that Shane was fired prior to this bout. I do know it wasn't Douglas in the match though he is credited for it.Anyway, it was still a good match which was more of a display for Austin and Pillman. At that time, I really didn't appreciate the Blondes but now I agree that they definitely didn't get the shot they deserved and WCW was dumb to split them up! One high spot was Steamboat using his famous flying body press on both Austin and Pillman at the same time and nearly pinning them both! Ends when Austin used his Stun Gun to drop Zenk into both the top rope and I believe part of the cage! Great match.Barry Windham Vs. Arn Anderson (NWA World Title Match) - A classic NWA style match with both men taking punishment from the other. Windham, by the way, bleeds like a pig in this one! Ends when Windham clobbers Anderson with his NWA title belt while the ref is down, winning this battle of former Horsemen.Vader Vs. "The British Bulldog" Davey Boy Smith (WCW World Title Match) - Was a pretty good bout but the best parts of this match is within the first 10 minutes. Impressive shows of strength by Davey Boy Smith in this one as he used his vertical suplex and even lifted Vader in the "electric chair"! Remember, Vader (at this time) was 450lbs. so this wasn't no easy feat by any means!It ends when Vader, after nearly being pinned by Davey but saved by Harley Race, hits The Bulldog with a chair causing a DQ.Overall, not a bad card but it wasn't a classic. Best bouts were the cage match along with Anderson Vs. Windham. Not a must buy but not a bad buy either.
summary: Okay Event With Two Classic Matches
Title: Wcw: Legends Reunion - Slamboree 93 VHS

reviewText: Alright I'm going to review anther retro wrestling Pay Per View the 1st Slamboree event they got rid of Wrestle War & decided to do a Legends Reunion. I have heard bad things about this show seeing it again it's solid. Now Dusty Rhodes & Ole Anderson are booking & these shows so you will see a lot of flaws. So what has gone on since Superbrawl I like telling the backstory comment me if you like it or not. Ok so on The Feburary 27th episode of WCW Saturday Night Ric Flair made his 1st apperance at Center Stage in almost 2 years. Arn Anderson made an apperance he said he's had this strange cramp in his hand his left hand no lol. Really though he gave the sgin of The 4 Horsemen. On The March 13th episode of WCW Saturday Night Tony Schiavone interviewed Barry Windham & asked him about Ric Flair's return he walked off the interview. The following week on WCW Saturday Night he was aksed about Ric Flair's return again by Tony Schiavone & again he walked off the interview. On The March 21st episode of The Main Event Eric Bischoff interiviewed Ric Flair. He said that he was taken by the moment when Barry Windham won The NWA World Championship cause of how prestigous that belt is. He addressed Barry Windham walking off of inrerviews he said that he is wearing a belt that I never lost & that is something that he will have to deal with. Bischoff asked I feel that you're here to take away that NWA World Heavyweight Championship away from Barry Windham. Flair said that I'm just happy to be back. I'm not ready to decide what I'm going to do. On The April 3rd episode of WCW Saturday Night Arn Anderson returned to the ring. Missy Hyatt for the past month & half had been trying to talk to Ric Flair. She was interviewed by Tony Schiavone she said what she has to tell Ric will change his life. Arn Anderson came out with Ric Flair's Wrestling Boots Arn said that it's time for us to get back in the ring for a tag team match. Flair said that he wasn't ready yet. The following week on WCW Saturday Night Arn Anderson challenged Barry Windham for The NWA World Heavyweight Championship. Barry Windham responded by saying Arn Anderson is nothing more than a Bridesmaid & that he is no longer a Horsemen. Later on in the show Barry Windham told 2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Alexander Bagwell to go get Arn for him. Arn was rigtht behind him & 2 Cold said why don't you tell him yourself. The show ended with Arn getting the better of Barry Windham. The following week Ric Flair responded to what happend Ric said Barry if you want me back in the ball game  Anderson cut him off he told Ric no disrespect but this problem with Windham is my busines he said it's time for me to step in front of the pack if you're ashamed of The 4 Horsement coming back then so be it. Windham was interviewed later on by Tony Schiavone he said I want to talk about 1 Horsemen in particular Arn Anderson is the lowest man on the totem pole. He wasn't the 1st Horsemen he wasn't the 2nd he wasn't the 3rd & there is a lot of doubt that he was the 4th even. He said that I had to do a lot of your dirty work cause you weren't capable of doing it yourself. The following week Of WCW Saturday Night it was announced that Barry Windham would defend The NWA World Heayweight Championship at Slamboree. On The May 8th episode of WCW Saturday Night Barry Windham was suppose to be the guest on a Flair For The Gold Windham called him Flair  tried to talk to him but he hung up on Ric. Ole Anderson cut a promo on this episode he gave the sign of The 4 Horsemen. The Following week on WCW Saturday Night The Hollywood Blonds were the guest on The Flair For The Gold  they just went after Flair & Anderson for there ages. Austin & Pillamn said that it's not a Flair For The Gold it's a Flair For The Old. Barry Windham cut a promo on this episode he finally addressed Ric Flair he said that Ric Flair has had his time. He said that a that The Horsemen are a thing of the past I'm a Lone Wolf now. The following week on WCW Saturday Night Flair said that The Original 4 Horsemen will be at Slamboree.  The British Bulldog challenged Vader for The WCW World title all through March WCW had a tour of Europe on March 11th in London Sting defeated Vader to win The WCW World Heavyweight Championship. 6 days later Vader defeated Sting to win the title back in Dublin Irelend. On The Aprl 10th episode of WCW Saturday Nigth Cactus Jack wanted a match with Vader for next week Vader accepted. The following week on WCW Saturday Nigth they had a fight with Cactus Jack winning by count out. When they came back from break Tony Schiavone interviewed Vader & Harley Race. Vader said "I'll fight you in the street in  my house in my backyard The WCW doesn't have to sanction it!" Harley Race said "Cactus Jack you just started thed  a  m  n  ed  est war that you can't complete!" Tony Schiavone said that we will try to get that match for you next week & I don't know if I want to be here for it. The following week on WCW Saturday Night they had another fight Harley Race removed the mats from ringside Vader powerbombed Cactus Jack on the concrete Cactus Jack was taken off on a stretcher Jesse Ventura went with them Harley Race took this bag that Cactus Jack had brought with him. It was announced that Vader would defend The WCW World Heavyweight Championship against The British Bulldog. The following week Vader was on a Flair For The Gold he said that The British Bulldog would be no different than Sting he will go to my School Of Pain. He also threatened Flair. The following week Harley Race said that Vader is preparing for The British Bulldog he will have a public work out here in 2 weeks on The May 22nd episode of WCW Saturday Night Vader squashed some jobbers The Bulldog came down to try & stop it Race told him to come into the ring Bulldog got in there & hit his powerslam on Vader. Boefore the show ended Vader started a fight with The Bulldog in the back. On The March 13th episode of WCW Saturday Night Rick Rude returnded to action from his neck injury. He wrestled a more aggressive style . On The May 1st episode of WCW Saturday Night Rude attacked Dustin Rhodes in The Trainers Room. Rude came out started talking trash Dustin Rhodes jumped out of the ring & on to Rude & they started fighting to close the show. On The May 15th episode of WCW World Wide Rick Rude defeated Dustin Rhodes to win The WCW United States Championship. The finish had a double pin which set up a tag team match Rick Rude & Paul Ordorff vs Dustin Rhodes & Kensuki Sasaki for this show. On The March 27th episode of WCW World Wide The Hollywood Blonds defeated Shane Douglas & Ricky Steamboat to win The Unified World Tag Team Championship. On The April 24th episode of WCW Saturday Night Ricky Steamboat got in a fight with Austin & Pillman it was 2 onn 1 until Shane Douglas made the save. The following week on WCW Saturday Night they announced that Steamboat & Douglas would face The Hollywood Blonds for The Unified World Tag Team Championship in a cage match & it would be there last chance. The following week on WCW Saturday Night 2 Mexican Wrestlers known as The Dos Hombre's wanted a match with The Hollywood Blonds cause they wanted to prove themselves to the promoters in Mexico. This was really a booking decison cause Shane Douglas had quit or he was fired so they made something up so Steamboat could be at the show. On The May 1st episode of WCW Saturday Night Colonel Robert Parker debuted. The following week on WCW Saturday Night he was scouting Van Hammer & he didn't like what he saw. So after his match he said some bad things to Van Hammer. Van Hammer grabbed him by the shirt collar but he let him go. Colonel Parker said he will pay for crossing his path. The following week he came to ringside with a stretcher & said he went home to Memphis & he found the man to face Van Hammer at Slamboree. Paul Orndorff won the tournament to crown a new Television Champion the fans started yelling Paula which drove him crazy. Scott Norton came to WCW & tartgeted Sting where they were going t have a match at this PPV until on The May 22nd episode of WCW Saturday Night they announced that Nailz from The WWF would face him instead. Norton left over pay issues or something. As you can read a lot has went on since Superbrawl. The buyrate was 0.46Date May 23, 1993Attendance 7,008Venue The OmniCity Atlanta, GeorgiaMax Payne plays the guitar to open the show. Eric Bischoff & Missy Hyatt are the analysts. Larry Zybszko sbstituted for Jesse Ventura who was hurt.2 Cold Scorpio & Marcus Alexander Bagwell Def Bobby Eaton & he who we will not speak of Chris Benoit ** an ok match.The Mystery Oppent revealed to be Sid Vicious with Colone Robert Parker Def Van Hammer DUD ***** for the reaction by the fans. You can tell Ole booked this. Hammer wouldn't be seen for years in WCW. Eric Bishcoff interviewed Red Bastein & Bugsy McGraw. Red said that he is happy he is retired. Bugsy said that Eric Bischoff had too much make up on.Don MurrcoDick Murdoch& Jimmy SnukavsJim BrunzellWahoo McDaniel& Black Jack Mulligan went to a no contest **Missy Hyatt interviewed Mad Dog Vachon & The Assassin. The Assassin stole the interview time he made an open challenge to Dusty Rhodes.Brad Armstrong replacing his Father Bob Armstrong & Thunderbolt Patterson Def Ivan Koloff & Baron Von Rascke half a star this match was bad.Then we go to a Flair For The Gold. Flair introduced Arn & Ole. Ric said that Tully Blanchard isn't going to show. WCW couldn't meet his demands Flair introduced the newest Horseman Paul Roma. It didn't go over well with the fans in The Omni. Flair was like doesn't he fit the demographic  ? Uh no. In The Ric Flair shoot interview he said he didn't fight managment over it cause he left 2 years prior over backstage politics. I agree this is the weakest version of The 4 Horsemen you never saw them together that much. It didn't feel like a team it felt like Ric & Arn & some guy that lent a hand to them. Getting back to this event Flair said Austin & Pillman you want The Nature Boy I'm getting back in the ring.Johnny Valentine joined Tony Schiavone & Larry Zybszko for commentaryNick Bockwinkle with Vern Gagne vs Dory Funk jr with Gene Keninski went to a draw ** & half stars decent match.Eric Bischoff interviewed Lou Thesz & Bob Giggel.Rick Rude & Paul Orndorff Def Dustin Rhodes & Kensuki Sasaki ** & a quarter of a star this was a half decent match.Gordon Solie held The Hall Of Fame inductions. Lou Thesz, Mike Graham accepting for Eddie Graham, Vern Gagne& Mr Wrestling II were inducted into The WCW Hall Of Fame. Missy Hyatt interviewed James Bleers & John Kolos they put over WCW.Sting Def The Prisoner * & half starsSting got a huge pop the fans yelled bulls  h  i  t when Nailz came out. Someone put a bounty out on Sting.Erc Bischoff interviewed Ox Baker & The Crusher. Awful interviewCage Match for The WCW-NWA World Tag Team ChampionshipChampions The Hollywood Blonds Steve Austin & Brian Pillman Def The Dos Hombre's Ricky Steamboat & Tom Zenk**** & a quarter of a star match of the nightEric Bischoff interviewed Dusty Rhodes, Stu Hart & Mr Wrestling II Dusty talked about The Assassin he said if you want me my big a  z  z is right here. Mr Wrestling II was happy to be in The HOF. Stu Hart hopes that The British Bulldog will defeat Vader tonight & win Worl title.NWA World Heavyweight ChampionshipChampion Barry Windham Def Arn Anderson *** a good match had a solid build up Barry did a manly blade job during the match.Wish it could've been given more time but this was a good match.WCW World Heavyweight ChampionshipThe British Bulldog Def Champion Big Van Vader with Harley Race by disqualifcation Vader retains ***WCW signed Bulldog to a big contract which is why he got pushed so quickly into a World title match against Vader. It looked like Vader was going to destroy Bulldog after the match but Sting came down & made the save.Bischoff interviwed Magnum TA who said that The Bulldog & Vader's problems haven't been settled here.Tony & Larry interviewed Vern Gagne he liked what he saw & will watch more WCW. This show had a so so undercard the last 3 matches saved this show from being mediore. It could've been better. The opener was ok the legends matches were alright The Flair For The Gold segment was good & bad. Sid's return was awesome. The Cage Match was great Steamboat & Zenk vs Austin & Pillman. So good show but the undercard could've been better. The tag match with Rick & Paul Orndorff vs Kensuki Sasaki & Dustin Rhodes it was halfway decent could've been better Sting vs Nailz served it's purpose The NWA & WCW title matches were pretty good.  My next review will be Beach Blast maybe a few days I'll review it maybe a week or  2 cause it all depends on how long it takes to get through these old episodes of WCW Saturday Night The Main Event & World Wide.
summary: The Past The Present & The Future 8/10
Title: Wcw: Legends Reunion - Slamboree 93 VHS

reviewText: The Legends 6 man tag team match between the team of Dick Murdoch,Don Muraco & Jimmy Snuka against the team of Wahoo McDaniel,Blackjack Mulligan & Jim Brunzell was not great but actually pretty fun. The tag team match between Ivan Koloff & Baron Von Rashchke against Thunderbolt Patterson & Brad Armstrong was crud. The Dory Funk Jr-Nick Bockwinkel match was a very good technical bout. The tag team match between Rick Rude & Paul Orndorff against Dustin Rhodes & Kensuke Sasaki was pretty uninspired but expected under the circumstances. The match between Sting & The Prisoner was trash. The cage match for World Tag Team titles between The Hollywood Blondes & Dos Hombres was not great but pretty good. The NWA World title match between Barry Windham & Arn Anderson was solid to say the least. The WCW World title match between Big Van Vader & Davey Boy Smith was a good power bout even with the stupid finish at the end. I give this PPV a 6 out of 10.
Title: Wcw: Legends Reunion - Slamboree 93 VHS

reviewText: OK usually I'm pretty cool with the classic WCW, I consider myself pretty educated after some 13 years of following sports entertainment, but this is a little steep, first off look at the cover, the legend himself rick flair right?  He's not even on the video!, and Dusty Rhodes either.  The highlight of this whole video is Austin and Pillman (halloywood blondes) vs steamboat and roma in the cage, and rude and orndorf vs dustin, not dusty-rhodes and some other guy.  The rest is kind of week, the legends matches are nastolgic but extremely hard on the eyes, the bulldbog vs vader in the main event is a less than stellar affair, and the absolute worst match on the PPV is Sting vs the coonvict, or "nailz".  Sting is a guy that can have a good matchwith just about anybody, but with "nailz" its a different story, sting literally puts over a guy who's arsenal consists of chokes and more chokes, this goes on for about 15 minutes all the while "nailz" is spiting all over the place, its no wonder why WCW canned him right after this PPV.  The crowd which literally consists of half empty seats really don't into this PPV at all, I would recommend Spring Stampede 93 if you want classic WCW.
summary: What are these guys talking about this thing is horrible!
Title: Wcw: Legends Reunion - Slamboree 93 VHS

reviewText: The Tag Title steel Cage was ok,The Rude/Ordorff Vs Rhodes/Kensaki was good,The Sting/Nailz was horrible but the World Title match was sorry since it didn't end cleanly butVader had to get himself DQ'd to keep the Belt.
Title: Wcw: Legends Reunion - Slamboree 93 VHS

reviewText: I guess if WWE 24/7 doesn't show this, and you can find it for a good price, and you didn't watch WCW back early 90's, then this pay per view wouldn't be a bad thing to check out.  You can learn a lot from it if you didn't know what WCW was like back then.True to early WCW style, very few of the matches have any buildup at all going into them.  Since this pay per view is called "A Legend's Reunion," it's mostly just old guys from different feds fighting each other.  Superfly, Dory Funk Jr., and a whole bunch of other legends are in the matches; plus there's a great tag title cage match, and Barry Windam defending his NWA title (I believe) against Arn Anderson.  Great talent.Zbysko makes a chillingly accurate prediction regarding the wrestling future of Stunning Steve Austin in this one.  Very odd indeed.I thought the main event between Vader and the Bulldog was excellent, even though there wasn't a clean win due to a chairshot from Vader.  These two guys were always good against each other, even though such a circumstance was very rare, and I didn't even know Bulldog was in WCW at this point.I think this tape shows what WCW did best.  Instead of gimmicks and storylines and things like that, there's just a bunch of traditional (not hardcore) wrestling.  It's like watching WCW Saturday Night, but without any jobbers.  Good stuff for old-school fans.Nobody ever said WCW was great at marketing.  The tape's package contains very little information, and shows pictures of guys who aren't involved in the event.  When you're selling a pay per view on video, you're supposed to put the card on the package.  That's just a no-brainer.  Otherwise you're implying that you have a really crummy card that you're too embarassed to show (which was probably often the case with WCW).WCW is dead for a reason, but this tape isn't it.  I recommend Slamboree '93.  It's Goldberg-free.
Title: Wcw: Legends Reunion - Slamboree 93 VHS
